required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Multiple-Dose Study To Evaluate The Pharmacokinetics And Safety Of Voriconazole In Immunocompromised Adolescents
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Intravenous To Oral Switch, Multiple Dose Study To Evaluate The Pharmacokinetics, Safety And Tolerability Of Voriconazole In Immunocompromised Adolescents Aged 12 To <17 Years Who Are At High Risk For Systemic Fungal Infection

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to collect additional pharmacokinetic and safety data of voriconazole in immunocompromised adolescents receiving intravenous and oral voriconazole. This will help establish voriconazole dosing recommendations for adolescents.

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve Over Dosing Interval at Steady State (AUC12,ss) Following IV Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7 (up to Day 20) at predose, 40, 78 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion
primary_outcome.description: AUC12,ss = Area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (predose) to twelve hours at steady-state. AUC12,ss was obtained by the Linear/Log trapezoidal method.

primary_outcome.measure: Peak Plasma Concentration at Steady State (Cmax,ss) Following IV Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7 (up to Day 20) at predose, 40, 78 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Cmax (Tmax) Following IV Administration
primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7 (up to Day 20) at predose, 40, 78 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion
Day 7 (up to Day 30) at predose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours postdose
primary_outcome.description: AUC12,ss = Area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (predose) to twelve hours at steady-state. AUC12,ss was obtained by the Linear/Log trapezoidal method.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 7 (up to Day 30) at predose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours postdose
Day 7 (up to Day 30) Predose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours postdose

secondary_outcome.description: AUC12 = Area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time zero (predose) to twelve hours. AUC12 was obtained by the Linear/Log trapezoidal method.

secondary_outcome.measure: Tmax Following an IV Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at predose, 60, 118 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion

secondary_outcome.measure: Cmax Following an IV Loading Dose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at predose, 60, 118 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion
Day 7 (up to Day 20) for IV; Day 7 (up to Day 30) for oral at predose

secondary_outcome.measure: AUC12,ss of N-oxide Voriconazole Metabolite (UK-121, 265) Following IV Administration
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 at predose, 60, 118 minutes, 4, 6, 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion and on Day 7 (up to Day 20) at predose, 40, 78 minutes, 4, 6 8 and 12 hours after start of infusion

secondary_outcome.time_frame: On Day 7 (up to Day 30) at predose, 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, and 12 hours postdose

other_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic Parameters of Voriconazole in Adolescents Compared to Historical Adult Data - AUC12 IV Loading Dose.
other_outcome.description: Data for this Outcome Measure are not reported here because the analysis population includes participants who were not enrolled in this study. ClinicalTrials.gov is designed for reporting results from only those participants who were enrolled in the study and described in the Participant Flow and Baseline Characteristics modules.

intervention.description: Voriconazole will be used for prophylaxis purpose. 6 mg/kg IV q12h on the first day (Day 1) and 4 mg/kg IV q12h for at least 5.5 days. The IV treatment is no more than 20 days. Then switch to 300 mg oral tablets q12h for at least 6.5 days. The total treatment duration is no more than 30 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who are expected to develop neutropenia following chemotherapy.
- Subjects who require treatment for the prevention of systemic fungal infection.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with a history of severe intolerance of azole antifungal agents.
- Subjects with documented bacterial or viral infection at the time of study entry who are not responding to appropriate treatment against the infection.

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: pharmacokinetics and safety data of voriconazole in immunocompromised adolescents

group.title: All Treatments
group.description: Voriconazole intravenous (IV) loading dose (6 mg/kg) was administered in the morning and evening on Day 1, and the IV maintenance dose (4 mg/kg) was administered in the morning and evening on Days 2 to 7 (up to Day 20 if clinically indicated). The oral maintenance dosing regimen (300 mg every 12 hours or 150 mg every 12 hours if subject weighed less than 40 kg) was administered following voriconazole IV and lasted 6.5 days (up to Day 30 if clinically indicated).

participants_list.participants: One participant received 2 days of oral; then received IV again before discontinuing from study.
One participant received voriconazole 150 mg every 12 hours during oral phase.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Voriconazole IV
group.description: Voriconazole IV loading dose (6 mg/kg) in the morning and evening on Day 1 and multiple IV doses (4 mg/kg) in the morning and evening on Days 2 to 7 (up to Day 20 if clinically indicated).

group.title: Voriconazole Oral
group.description: Oral maintenance dosing regimen (300 mg every 12 hours or 150 mg every 12 hours if subject weighed less than 40 kg) was administered following voriconazole IV and lasted 6.5 days (up to Day 30 if clinically indicated).

event.sub_title: Acute graft versus host disease in intestine
Acute graft versus host disease in liver
Acute graft versus host disease in intestine
Acute graft versus host disease in skin

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
